chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (le : seq expr) (l : seq R) (n : nat) (x : R), interp (set_nth 0 l n x) (AppExt k f le) = apply k f (foldr (fun (v : nat) (acc : nat -> R) (i : nat) => if ssrnat.eqn i v then interp (set_nth 0 l n x) (nth (Cst 0) le v) else acc i) (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) (index_not_const le n))

Premises:
Notation seq := list
Rn = fix Rn (n : nat) (T : Type) {struct n} : Type := match n with | 0%nat => T | S n0 => R -> Rn n0 T end : nat -> Type -> Type Argument scopes are [nat_scope type_scope]
set_nth : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T -> seq T
*** [ R : Set ]
Inductive expr : Type := Var : nat -> expr | AppExt : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> seq expr -> expr | AppExtD : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> nat -> seq expr -> expr | App : expr -> expr -> expr | Subst : expr -> expr -> expr | Cst : R -> expr | Binary : bop -> expr -> expr -> expr | Unary : uop -> expr -> expr | Int : expr -> expr -> expr -> expr For Var: Argument scope is [nat_scope] For AppExt: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ list_scope] For AppExtD: Argument scopes are [nat_scope _ nat_scope list_scope] For Cst:
interp = fix interp (l : seq R) (e : expr) {struct e} : R := match e with | Var n => nth R0 l n | AppExt k f le => apply k f (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) | AppExtD k f n le => Derive_Rn k f n (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) | App e1 e2 => interp (interp l e2 :: l) e1 | Subst e1 e2 => interp (set_nth R0 l 0 (interp l e2)) e1 | Cst c => c | Binary o e1 e2 => match o with |
foldr = fun (T R : Type) (f : T -> R -> R) (z0 : R) => fix foldr (s : seq T) : R := match s with | [::] => z0 | x :: s' => f x (foldr s') end : forall T R : Type, (T -> R -> R) -> R -> seq T -> R Arguments T, R are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope _ list_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
index_not_const = fun (l : seq expr) (n : nat) => [seq v <- iota 0 (size l) | ~~ is_const (nth (Cst 0) l v) n] : seq expr -> nat -> seq nat Argument scopes are [list_scope nat_scope]
f = fun f : family => let (ind, f0, _) := f in f0 : family -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ R_scope R_scope] f is a coercion
AppExt : forall k : nat, Rn k R -> seq expr -> expr
Notation "_ + _" was already used in scope nat_scope. [notation-overridden,parsing]
nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : seq T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: s' => match n with | 0%nat => x | S n' => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ list_scope nat_scope]
ssrnat.eqn = fix eqn (m n : nat) {struct m} : bool := match m with | 0%nat => match n with | 0%nat => true | S _ => false end | S m' => match n with | 0%nat => false | S n' => eqn m' n' end end : nat -> nat -> bool Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : (n <= n)%nat | le_S : forall m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (n <= S m)%nat For le: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope] For le_n: Argument scope is [nat_scope] For le_S: Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope _]
interp_domain = fix interp_domain (l : seq R) (d : domain) {struct d} : Prop := match d with | Never => False | Always => True | Partial p e => p (interp l e) | Derivable n k f le => ex_derive_Rn k f n (nth 0 [seq interp l i | i <- le]) | Derivable2 m n k f le => let le' := [seq interp l i | i <- le] in locally_2d (fun u v : R => ex_derive_Rn k f m (fun i : nat => if ssrnat.eqn i m then u else if ssrnat.eqn i n then v else nth 0 le' i)) (nth 0 le' m) (nth 0 le' n) /\ continuity_2d_pt (fun u v : R => Derive_Rn k f m...
interp_set_nth : forall (n : nat) (l : seq R) (e : expr), interp (set_nth 0 l n (nth 0 l n)) e = interp l e
is_const_correct : forall (e : expr) (n : nat), is_const e n = true -> forall (l : seq R) (x1 x2 : R), interp (set_nth 0 l n x1) e = interp (set_nth 0 l n x2) e
index_not_const_correct : forall (n : nat) (l : seq expr) (k : nat), ~ k \in index_not_const l n -> is_const (nth (Cst 0) l k) n = true
interp_domain_set_nth : forall (n : nat) (l : seq R) (b : domain), interp_domain (set_nth 0 l n (nth 0 l n)) b < -> interp_domain l b
expr_ind' : forall P : expr -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (Var n)) -> (forall (k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (le : seq expr), foldr (fun (e : expr) (acc : Prop) => P e /\ acc) True le -> P (AppExt k f le)) -> (forall (k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (n : nat) (le : seq expr), foldr (fun (e : expr) (acc : Prop) => P e /\ acc) True le -> P (AppExtD k f n le)) -> (forall e1 e2 : expr, P e1 -> P e2 -> P (App e1 e2)) ->...-> forall e : expr, P e
apply_ext : forall (T : Type) (k : nat) (f : Rn k T) (g1 g2 : nat -> R), (forall n : nat, (n < k)%nat -> g1 n = g2 n) -> apply k f g1 = apply k f g2
nth_map' : forall (x1 : ?T1) (T2 : Type) (f : ?T1 -> T2) (n : nat) (s : seq ?T1), nth (f x1) [seq f i | i <- s] n = f (nth x1 s n) where ?T1 : [ |- Type]
interval_finite_subdiv : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal), a <= b -> {l : seq R | head 0 l = a /\ last 0 l = b /\ (forall i : nat, (S i < size l)%nat -> nth 0 l i < nth 0 l (S i) <= nth 0 l i + eps)}
interp_ext : forall (l1 l2 : seq R) (e : expr), (forall k : nat, nth 0 l1 k = nth 0 l2 k) -> interp l1 e = interp l2 e
nth_map : forall (T1 : Type) (x1 : T1) (T2 : Type) (x2 : T2) (f : T1 -> T2) (n : nat) (s : seq T1), ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) -> nth x2 [seq f i | i <- s] n = f (nth x1 s n)
domain_ind' : forall P : domain -> Prop, P Never -> P Always -> (forall (p : R -> Prop) (e : expr), P (Partial p e)) -> (forall (n k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (le : seq expr), P (Derivable n k f le)) -> (forall (m n k : nat) (f : Rn k R) (le : seq expr), P (Derivable2 m n k f le)) -> (forall (n : nat) (e : expr), P (Continuous n e)) -> (forall (m n : nat) (e : expr), P (Continuous2 m n e)) -> (forall f e1 e2 : expr, P (Integrable f e1 e2)) ->...-> forall d : domain, P d
last_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1) (x : T1), last (f x) [seq f i | i <- s] = f (last x s)
interval_finite_subdiv_between : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal) (Hab : a <= b), let l := proj1_sig (interval_finite_subdiv a b eps Hab) in forall i : nat, (i < size l)%nat -> a <= nth 0 l i <= b
domain_ind : forall P : domain -> Prop, P Never -> P Always -> (forall (P0 : R -> Prop) (e : expr), P (Partial P0 e)) -> (forall (n k : nat) (r : Rn k R) (l : seq expr), P (Derivable n k r l)) -> (forall (n n0 k : nat) (r : Rn k R) (l : seq expr), P (Derivable2 n n0 k r l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (e : expr), P (Continuous n e)) -> (forall (n n0 : nat) (e : expr), P (Continuous2 n n0 e)) -> (forall e e0 e1 : expr, P (Integrable e e0 e1)) ->...-> forall d : domain, P d
domain_rect : forall P : domain -> Type, P Never -> P Always -> (forall (P0 : R -> Prop) (e : expr), P (Partial P0 e)) -> (forall (n k : nat) (r : Rn k R) (l : seq expr), P (Derivable n k r l)) -> (forall (n n0 k : nat) (r : Rn k R) (l : seq expr), P (Derivable2 n n0 k r l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (e : expr), P (Continuous n e)) -> (forall (n n0 : nat) (e : expr), P (Continuous2 n n0 e)) -> (forall e e0 e1 : expr, P (Integrable e e0 e1)) ->...-> forall d : domain, P d
is_const = fix is_const (e : expr) (n : nat) {struct e} : bool := match e with | Var v => ~~ ssrnat.eqn v n | AppExt _ _ le => foldr (fun (v : expr) (acc : bool) => is_const v n && acc) true le | AppExtD _ _ _ _ => false | App f e0 => is_const f (S n) && is_const e0 n | Subst f e0 => (ssrnat.eqn n 0 || is_const f n) && is_const e0 n | Cst _ => true | Binary _ e1 e2 => is_const e1 n && is_const e2 n | Unary _ e0 => is_const e0 n | Int f e1 e2 => [&& is_const f (S n), is_const e1 n & is_const e2 n]...
nth_mkseq : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (f : nat -> T) (n i : nat), ssrnat.leq (S i) n -> nth x0 (mkseq f n) i = f i
expr_rec : forall P : expr -> Set, (forall n : nat, P (Var n)) -> (forall (k : nat) (r : Rn k R) (l : seq expr), P (AppExt k r l)) -> (forall (k : nat) (r : Rn k R) (n : nat) (l : seq expr), P (AppExtD k r n l)) -> (forall e : expr, P e -> forall e0 : expr, P e0 -> P (App e e0)) -> (forall e : expr, P e -> forall e0 : expr, P e0 -> P (Subst e e0)) -> (forall r : R, P (Cst r)) ->...-> forall e : expr, P e
expr_ind : forall P : expr -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (Var n)) -> (forall (k : nat) (r : Rn k R) (l : seq expr), P (AppExt k r l)) -> (forall (k : nat) (r : Rn k R) (n : nat) (l : seq expr), P (AppExtD k r n l)) -> (forall e : expr, P e -> forall e0 : expr, P e0 -> P (App e e0)) -> (forall e : expr, P e -> forall e0 : expr, P e0 -> P (Subst e e0)) -> (forall r : R, P (Cst r)) ->...-> forall e : expr, P e
expr_rect : forall P : expr -> Type, (forall n : nat, P (Var n)) -> (forall (k : nat) (r : Rn k R) (l : seq expr), P (AppExt k r l)) -> (forall (k : nat) (r : Rn k R) (n : nat) (l : seq expr), P (AppExtD k r n l)) -> (forall e : expr, P e -> forall e0 : expr, P e0 -> P (App e e0)) -> (forall e : expr, P e -> forall e0 : expr, P e0 -> P (Subst e e0)) -> (forall r : R, P (Cst r)) ->...-> forall e : expr, P e
uniq_index_not_const : forall (n : nat) (l : seq expr), uniq (index_not_const l n)
pos_Rl = fix pos_Rl (l : Rlist) (i : nat) {struct l} : R := match l with | RList.nil => 0 | RList.cons a l' => match i with | 0%nat => a | S i' => pos_Rl l' i' end end : Rlist -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope]
size_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), size [seq f i | i <- s] = size s
nth_set_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (n : nat) (y : T), ssrfun.eqfun (nth x0 (set_nth x0 s n y)) (ssrfun.fun_of_simpl (ssrfun.SimplFunDelta (fun _ : eqtype.Equality.sort ssrnat.nat_eqType => eqtype.app_fdelta (eqtype.FunDelta (aT:=ssrnat.nat_eqType) n y) (nth x0 s))))
interp_domain_ext : forall (l1 l2 : seq R) (b : domain), (forall k : nat, nth 0 l1 k = nth 0 l2 k) -> interp_domain l1 b -> interp_domain l2 b
mem_iota : forall (m n : nat) (i : eqtype.Equality.sort ssrnat.nat_eqType), (i \in iota m n) = ssrnat.leq m i && ssrnat.leq (S i) (ssrnat.addn m n)
foldr_prop_nth : forall (d : ?T) (l : seq ?T) (n : nat), foldr (fun (d0 : ?T) (acc : Prop) => ?P d0 /\ acc) True l -> ?P d -> ?P (nth d l n) where ?T : [ |- Type] ?P : [ |- ?T -> Prop]
ssrnat.eqnP = fun n m : nat => iffP idP ((fun (_evar_0_ : (fun n0 : nat => forall m0 : nat, ssrnat.eqn n0 m0 -> n0 = m0) 0%nat) (_evar_0_0 : forall n0 : nat, (fun n1 : nat => forall m0 : nat, ssrnat.eqn n1 m0 -> n1 = m0) n0 -> (fun n1 : nat => forall m0 : nat, ssrnat.eqn n1 m0 -> n1 = m0) (S n0)) => nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => forall m0 : nat, ssrnat.eqn n0 m0 -> n0 = m0) _evar_0_ _evar_0_0 n) (fun __top_assumption...
SF_seq.SF_ly_f1 : forall (f1 : R -> ?T) (P : seq R), SF_seq.SF_ly (SF_seq.SF_seq_f1 f1 P) = Rcomplements.belast [seq f1 i | i <- P] where ?T : [ |- Type]
